meanings.definition: In the direction of the shore.
meanings.sent1: The boat sailed shorewards as the sun began to set.
meanings.sent2: The swimmer headed shorewards after a long day at sea.
meanings.sent3: The seagull flew shorewards, eager to reach the safety of the land.
meanings.sent4: The waves crashed shorewards, carrying treasures from the deep.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse beacon shone shorewards, guiding ships to safety.

meanings.sent1: The children ran shorewards, excited to build sandcastles.
meanings.sent2: The fishermen steered their boat shorewards to unload the day's catch.
meanings.sent3: The playful dolphins leaped shorewards, showing off their acrobatic skills.
meanings.sent4: The tide pulled shorewards, revealing hidden treasures in the sand.
meanings.sent5: The salty breeze blew shorewards, carrying the scent of the ocean.
